heading: Comparing like Fractions and Fractions with same numerator

topics.heading: Comparing like Fractions and Fractions with same numerator

questions.question: Grandma showed Tom and Maya two rectangular-shaped plots, whose areas were shaded differently. Find out which plot has more shaded area.
If Maya has 17/56 of a chocolate bar and Tom has 11/56 of a chocolate bar, who has more chocolate?
options: Both have the same amount of chocolate

questions.question: Grandma gave them two rectangular plots of the same size to paint as shown below. Find the fraction of the given plot i & plot ii and tell which plot has a larger shaded area.
Tom asked Grandma if she could tell him, Which of the following fractions are like fractions.
If Grandma has 13/81 of a bag of flour and Maya has 12/81 of a bag, whose bag has more flour?

Maya and Tom are painting two rectangular garden plots for their grandma. The (plot i) has 19/51 of its area shaded, and the (plot ii )has 19/50 of its area shaded. Which garden plot has a larger shaded area, and why?
If Tom has 11/12 of a cookie and Maya has 9/12 of a cookie, who has more cookies?

While sorting Grandma's button collection, Maya and Tom found that 79/15 of the buttons in one box were blue and 79/18 of the buttons in another box were blue. Which box has a larger portion of blue buttons?
options: Both boxes have the same portion

questions.question: Maya and Tom are painting garden plots. Plot A has 12/55 of its area shaded, Plot B has 13/55, and Plot C has 44/55. Arrange the plots in ascending order based on the shaded area.
options: Plot A, Plot B, Plot C
Plot C, Plot B, Plot A
Plot B, Plot A, Plot C
Plot A, Plot C, Plot B

questions.question: In the kitchen, Grandma had two plates of cookies. On one plate, 51/12 of the cookies were chocolate chips, and on the other plate, 51/17 of the cookies were chocolate chips. Which plate has a larger portion of chocolate chip cookies?
options: Both plates have the same portion

questions.question: Maya and Tom found two jars of marbles in the attic. The first jar has 33/10 of its marbles painted red, and the second jar has 33/25 of its marbles painted red. Which jar has a larger portion of red marbles?
options: Both jars have the same portion

questions.question: Grandma has a basket of apples. If Maya ate 1/8 of the apples, how many apples did Tom eat if he ate an equivalent fraction?

Tom asked Maya to arrange the following fractions in descending order:
14/86, 14/256, 14/116, 14/186, 14/136

Maya and Tom were sorting through Grandma's fruit basket. They found that 17/91 of the fruits were apples, 44/91 of the oranges, and 59/91 of the bananas. Arrange the fruits in descending order based on the portion that is ripe.

Maya asked Tom to arrange the following fractions in ascending order:
59/3, 59/6, 59/9, 59/22, 59/28.

Grandma asked Maya and Tom to arrange the following fractions in descending order:
13/57, 13/39, 13/51, 13/41, 13/47

Maya and Tom found three jars of marbles. In the first jar, 27/95 of the marbles were blue, in the second jar, 38/95, and in the third jar, 47/95. Arrange the jars in descending order based on the portion of blue marbles.
options: First jar, second jar, third jar
Third jar, second jar, first jar
Third jar, first jar, second jar

questions.question: In the garden, Maya watered 1/2 of the plants. If Tom watered an equivalent fraction of plants, how many plants did he water?
Grandma had a basket of apples. If Maya ate 1/5 of the apples, how many apples did Tom eat if he ate an equivalent fraction?
Maya and Tom were baking cookies. If Maya used 2/3 cup of sugar for the recipe, how many cups of sugar did Tom use if he used an equivalent fraction?
